text.content:
You seek to become more than what you are. In the heat of battle or in life’s most tranquil moments, you reach for a greater state to reach transcendence, self-improvement, or a hint of divinity. You’ve devoted yourself to a philosophy that imparts lessons and ideals for spiritual fulfillment. You utter meditations that lifts your spirit high, entering a trance that taps into a great power that exemplifies the ideals you are dedicated to. During moments of zeniths, your heightened self brings the divine to the world.

Key Ability: DEXTERITY

At 1st level, your class gives you an attribute boost to Dexterity.

Hit Points: 8 plus your Constitution modifier

You increase your maximum number of HP by this number at 1st level and every level thereafter.

Roleplaying the Dervish

During Combat Encounters...

You enter a combat trance, reciting meditations mentally or verbally as you move and act in ways appropriate to your chosen parable. In the moment during your trance, you feel closer to the concepts you envision, reaching a spiritual high that lets you unleash divine powers.

During Social Encounters...

You try to act according to the philosophies you embody. You might reject certain acts or try to behave in certain ways to live up to chosen standards, and become more than you are in your daily life.

While Exploring...

You recount your parables and take heed of its lessons, to be aware of things you should do or avoid in your surroundings. You try to apply your learnings to situations you encounter on the road.

In Downtime...

You spend your time improving yourself and practicing the lessons of your parables in a safer context. You might go into study or confer with philosophers about the world or the divine, or learn new meditations and understand how it can be embedded into your philosophies.

You Might...

●       Try and find a lesson that might apply in any scenario before you.

●       Strive for loftier goals and try to reach new spiritual heights.

●       Study new ideas and lessons both practical and philosophical.

Others Probably…

●       View you as a religious scholar, whether it may be true or not.

●       Look to you for timely and sage advice.

●       Be perplexed when you enter your meditative trances.


Initial Proficiencies

At 1st level, you gain the listed proficiency ranks in the following statistics. You are untrained in anything not listed unless you gain a better proficiency rank in some other way.

Perception

Trained in Perception

Saving Throws

Trained in Fortitude

Expert in Reflex

Expert in Will

Skills

Trained in Religion

Trained in a number of additional skills equal to 3 plus your Intelligence modifier

Attacks

Trained in simple weapons

Trained in martial weapons

Trained in unarmed attacks

Defenses

Trained in light armor

Trained in unarmored defense

Class DC

Trained in dervish Class DC

Class Features

You gain these abilities as a Dervish. Abilities gained at higher levels list the level at which you gain them next to the features' names.

Your LevelClass Features
1Ancestry and background, attribute boosts, initial proficiencies, zeal, zealous strikes, parables, dervish feat
2Dervish feat, skill feat
3General feat, skill increase, fortitude expertise, calm mantra

5Ancestry feat, attribute boosts, skill increase, dervish weapon expertise, perception expertise
6Dervish feat, skill feat
7General feat, skill increase, perception expertise, weapon specialization, honed mind

10Attribute boosts, dervish feat, skill feat

12Dervish feat, skill feat

14Dervish feat, skill feat
15Attribute boosts, general feat, skill increase, greater weapon specialization, divine footfalls
16Dervish feat, skill feat
17Ancestry feat, skill increase, trance master, reverse recitation
18Dervish feat, skill feat
19General feat, skill increase, light armor mastery, celestial steps
20Attribute boosts, dervish feat, skill feat

Ancestry and background

In addition to what you get from your class at 1st level, you have the benefits of your selected ancestry and background.

Attribute Boosts

In addition to what you get from your class at 1st level, you have four free boosts to different attribute modifiers.

At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, you get four free boosts to different attribute modifiers. If an attribute modifier is already +4 or higher, it takes two boosts to increase it; you get a partial boost, and you must boost that attribute again at a later level to increase it by 1.

Initial Proficiencies

At 1st level, you gain a number of proficiencies that represent your basic training. These proficiencies are noted at the start of this class.

Dervish Feats

At 1st level and every even-numbered level, you gain a dervish class feat.

Zeal

@Embed[Compendium.immortal-ardor.classes.Item.pzJHebAV1UEFBJRn inline hr=false]

Parables

@Embed[Compendium.immortal-ardor.classes.Item.caphhFdQ1bZ1eHe3 inline hr=false]

Zealous Strikes

@Embed[Compendium.immortal-ardor.classes.Item.kyVzYnHM3QAqr0O8 inline hr=false]

Skill Feats Level 2

At 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a skill feat. You must be trained or better in the corresponding skill to select a skill feat.

General FeatsLevel 3

At 3rd level and every 4 levels thereafter, you gain a general feat.

Skill IncreasesLevel 3

At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a skill increase. You can use this increase to either become trained in one skill you’re untrained in, or become an expert in one skill in which you’re already trained.

At 7th level, you can use skill increases to become a master in a skill in which you’re already an expert, and at 15th level, you can use them to become legendary in a skill in which you’re already a master.

Fortitude ExpertiseLevel 3

Your physique has grown hardy in your adventures. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

Calm MantraLevel 3

In addition to the ancestry feat you started with, you gain an ancestry feat at 5th level and every 4 levels thereafter.

You are a bastion of talent and creativity. While you can grasp magic, you see possibilities that extend beyond simple rote applications or manifestations bestowed by other entities. Some might think you a spellcaster bestowed with innate talent, but that isn’t your gift – no, you don’t cast magic, you create magic. You are a creator that wields the tools of expression, envisioning what magic could be. Some might call you apocryphal, or even mistake you for a fake, talentless trickster. But you are an erudite and a visionary both; with a little bit of planning and a sprinkle of catalyzing reagents, you can express magic in beautiful, colorful ways.

Key Ability: INTELLIGENCE OR CHARISMA

At 1st level, your class gives you an attribute boost to Intelligence or Charisma, depending on your luminary’s medium.

Hit Points: 6 plus your Constitution modifier

You increase your maximum number of HP by this number at 1st level and every level thereafter.

Roleplaying the Luminary

During Combat Encounters...

You sprinkle your magical catalysts to manifest your spells in unconventional ways and exploit the fabric of magic to create fantastical effects that explode in myriad colors, lights, or patterns.

During Social Encounters...

You bring forth creative ideas to the table, using unique insights from your keen intellect tempered by your desire to see things not as they are, but what they could be.

While Exploring...

You find novel and intriguing ways to apply magic to uniquely solve your roadblocks and look for unique ingredients you can pick up and turn into catalysts.

In Downtime...

You look for inspirations and ideas to create brand new ways to interpret magic, and debate and draft your ideas to peers who could listen in social or academic settings. You might also spend time to create novel shows and displays of your magic to entertain or to educate.

You Might...

  • Keep a record that lists your favorite catalysts, and the best times to use which exploits.

  • Spend time drawing or drafting ideas for your next great display of magical genius.

  • Go out of your way to one-up people who wield magic in their conventional ways.

Others Probably…

  • Think of you as an eccentric sorcerer.

  • Be captivated or impressed at the explosive output of your magic.

  • Consider you as a trickster who uses tools to fool others into thinking you are a spellcaster.

Initial Proficiencies

At 1st level, you gain the listed proficiency ranks in the following statistics. You are untrained in anything not listed unless you gain a better proficiency rank in some other way.

Perception

Trained in Perception

Saving Throws

Trained in Fortitude

Trained in Reflex

Expert in Will

Skills

Trained in one skill determined by your luminary’s medium

Trained in a number of additional skills equal to 2 plus your Intelligence modifier

Attacks

Trained in simple weapons

Trained in unarmed attacks

Defenses

Trained in light armor

Trained in unarmored defense

Class DC

Trained in luminary Class DC

Spells

Trained in spell attack modifier

Trained in spell DC

Class Features

You gain these abilities as a Luminary. Abilities gained at higher levels list the level at which you gain them next to the features' names.

Your LevelClass Features

2Luminary feat, skill feat

158th-rank spells, Attribute boosts, general feat, master spellcaster, skill increase, eye for talent

179th-rank spells, Ancestry feat, skill increase, visionary catalysts
18Luminary feat, skill feat
19General feat, skill increase, legendary spellcaster, visionary paragon
20Attribute boosts, dervish feat, skill feat

Ancestry and background

In addition to what you get from your class at 1st level, you have the benefits of your selected ancestry and background.

Attribute Boosts

In addition to what you get from your class at 1st level, you have four free boosts to different attribute modifiers.

At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, you get four free boosts to different attribute modifiers. If an attribute modifier is already +4 or higher, it takes two boosts to increase it; you get a partial boost, and you must boost that attribute again at a later level to increase it by 1.

Initial Proficiencies

At 1st level, you gain a number of proficiencies that represent your basic training. These proficiencies are noted at the start of this class.

Luminary Spellcasting

* - One of your Luminary’s spell slots per rank is limited to your Motif’s favored tradition. One spell prepared in your collection per rank is one of your Motif’s granted spells and is always prepared.
** - The Luminary’s 19th level feature, Visionary Paragon grants you a 10th rank spell slot specific to your motif. You don’t add 10th rank spells to your collection, but you prepare that spell into the 10th rank spell slot and expend it when you cast that spell.
